Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2008 01:44PM trustinchrist wrote: I am 41 years old and went in for my first mammogram.  They found a cyst, did a needle aspiration and wanted me to come back in six months for a baseline.  I went in and they found more microcalcifications in my second mammo than was in my first.  Then I got a core biopsy done.  I was diagnosed with DCIS in April.  I had a lumpectomy in May and the doctor said it did NOT come back with a clear margin on one side so he went back in and got a clear margin the second time.  I'm currently undergoing 33 treatments of radiation with five more to go.  The last five treatments is where they concentrate on the spot where they removed the cancer cells rather than radiating the entire breast.  I'm glad it's almost over because I am experiencing the burning, the breast tenderness, and the itching.  But I believe that God is walking by my side to help me through all this and He has helped me maintain my strength and my sanity.  If I start to freak out, like I almost did when they were doing the MRI of my breast, I just concentrated on saying a verse from the Bible.  That seemed to help.  May God be with you in your time of need, and if you don't know Him, now is a good time to start a relationship with Him.  God bless.
